Module atu.software
Package ie.atu.sw

Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.GameObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameObjectable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Player, Spider
public abstract class GameObject extends Object implements GameObjectable
This is the GameObject for entity's such as the Player or Spider, game engines such as Unity take a similar approach, with each GameObject in the game having a start and update method

  • Constructor Details

    • GameObject

      public GameObject(Position characterLocation, String spriteLocation) throws Exception
      Construct a new GameObject, you need a Position and String location of sprites
      Parameters:
      characterLocation - Position object containing X and Y location.
      spriteLocation - String location of the sprites for the current GameObject
      Throws:
      Exception - thrown when can't find sprite files.

  • Method Details

    • setSpritesheet

      protected void setSpritesheet(Sprite[][] spriteSheet)
      Set the current spritesheet for this GameObject.
      Parameters:
      spriteSheet - contain an array of Sprite for this GameObject.

    • nextSprite

      protected void nextSprite()
      Go to the sprite for the current direction in the spritesheet

    • changeColour

      protected void changeColour(int newColour)
      This method allows you to change the colour of all the sprites in the GameObject spritesheet.
      Parameters:
      newColour - you want your spritesheet to be.

    • getCurrentSprite

      public BufferedImage getCurrentSprite()
      Fetch current sprite for this GameObject.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage that is the current sprite.
